singing - As the passing hour was good
So will the doming hour be better
And yet it may prove hard
Or worse, if God so wishes.
- Blessed be the hour which saw the
Saviourâ€™s birth
And Mary who bore him
And John who baptised him
May the Saviour grant us a calm night
May the Saviour grant us a calm voyage
May the Saviour grant us a calm crossing.
singing - By now the horizon hides the Canaries
We are sailing unchartered seas
May God be with us on this voyage.
It is the unchartered sea
The rending, sundering sea
Which for countless days and nights
Rules our destinies at will.
What were we?
Entombed in the galleys
We lived in desolate misery;
In impiety we lived
In hatred and in crime;
we lived in slavery.
Merciful son
Set us free from slavery!
Under your rule of ruthlessness!
What will be our fate!
Can hope be our m$te
Or a messenger of death?
What will be our fate?
